snippet: The center-right government said that the pensions revamp is nothing more than an accounting change and does not amount to nationalization.
abstract: Polish government announces a draft bill that would require private pension funds to transfer about 35.2 billion euros, or $47.6 billion, in government bonds to the state in February 2014; insists pensions revamp is nothing more than an accounting change that will not affect pensioners but critics liken move to a Soviet-style nationalization of private assets.

byline.original: By DAN BILEFSKY and MATEUSZ ZURAWIK

lead_paragraph: The center-right government said that the pensions revamp is nothing more than an accounting change and does not amount to nationalization.

headline.main: Poland Moves Forward on Bill That Would Transfer Private Pensions to State
headline.print_headline: Poland Moves Forward on Bill That Would Transfer Private Pensions to State
